title: 112_hr6082
content: The Act is titled "Congressional Replacement of President Obama's Energy-Restricting and Job-Limiting Offshore Drilling Plan." It defines terms like "OCS Planning Area" and "Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017)." The Act requires the implementation of the proposed oil and gas leasing program for 2012-2017. The Act mandates the implementation of the Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017) according to the specified schedule and applicable laws. Additionally, the Secretary of the Interior is required to conduct modified and additional lease sales in OCS Planning Areas as outlined in a specified table. Lease Sale No. in various OCS Planning Areas from 2012 to 2014 include Western Gulf of Mexico, Mid-Atlantic, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, Central Gulf of Mexico, Southern California, Cook Inlet, Chukchi Sea. Lease Sale No. in OCS Planning Areas from 2014 to 2016 include Southern California, Mid-Atlantic, Central Gulf of Mexico, Western Gulf of Mexico, Beaufort Sea, Chukchi Sea, North Atlantic, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, North Aleutian Basin. Lease sales in various OCS planning areas from 2015 to 2017 include Central Gulf of Mexico, Eastern Gulf of Mexico, Beaufort Sea, Southern California, Mid-Atlantic, and South Atlantic-South Carolina. Lease sales in OCS planning areas from 2015 to 2017 include specific sale numbers conducted in accordance with proposed leasing programs. Sale numbers 229, 227, 233, 244, 225, 231, 238, 235, 242, 246, 226, 241, 237, 248, and 247 are part of the Proposed Final Outer Continental Shelf Oil & Gas Leasing Program (2012-2017). Sale numbers 220, 212, 228, 230, 221, 245, 232, 234, 239, 217, and 243 are part of the Draft Proposed Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) Oil and Gas Leasing Program for 2010-2015. Sale numbers 249 and 250 are for lease tracts in the Southern California OCS Planning Area and Mid-Atlantic OCS Planning Area. Lease tracts in Southern California and Mid-Atlantic OCS Planning Areas are determined by the Secretary for lease sales in specified years, as per the provisions of this Act. SEC. 4. SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE LEASE SALE. The Secretary will offer leases for sale in the Santa Maria and Santa Barbara/Ventura Basins of the Southern California OCS Planning Area by December 31, 2013. Leases will require development and production from existing offshore infrastructure or onshore-based drilling. SEC. 5. NATIONAL DEFENSE. The Secretary of Defense retains authority to designate national defense areas on the Outer Continental Shelf. No oil or gas activities under this Act should conflict with military operations. SEC. 6. ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT REQUIREMENT. The Secretary of the Interior must prepare a multisale environmental impact statement for lease sales required by the Act. The statement should identify a preferred leasing action and one alternative proposal, analyzing their environmental effects and mitigation measures. Nonleasing alternative courses of action are not required to be identified or analyzed. SEC. 7. Eastern Gulf of Mexico is excluded from the Act. SEC. 8. Lease sales off the coasts of South Carolina and California require consultation with state officials and focus on areas with promising energy resources.
